summary: Rabbits are small mammals found all over the world. They belong to the Leporidae family, which also includes hares. Rabbits are known for their quick hopping and sharp senses, helping them escape predators. They live in nests or burrows and can be found alone or in groups. Humans have raised rabbits for meat, fur, and wool since ancient times. In some places, they can cause ecological problems. Rabbits are often seen as symbols of fertility and innocence in different cultures.
title: Rabbit
